content: Investments STI ETF Asked by AnonymousAsked on 28 May 2019Can investing in STI etf make one 'rich' ?4 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Vincent Tan Wen Bin, Assistant Vice President at Thinkers AllianceLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 28 May 2019The high point of STI ETF before the crash in 2008 was at 3800. After 11 years, STI ETF seats at 3100+ range. Which means if you hold the ETF till now and bought at 3800 you will still making a loss. STI ETF is an index that you can invest in. But don't just focus on one instrument. Put your eggs in different basket.0 comments1

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 28 May 2019Don't know. Nobody knows. Investment is not guaranteed and past performance is not indicative of future performance.Instead of taking a bet of one tiny country's companies, why don't you invest in the whole world? Literally tens of thousands of stocks instead. As long as the whole world continues to grow, you are bound to get some positive return. Will it make you rich? Still no clue, but possibly a better bet than just the STI ETF.0 comments1

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 28 May 2019Define rich....Andrew Hallam author of millionaire teacher invests in ETFs and as the name suggests a millionaire.Also depends on which ETF, how you invest, and how much you invest.0 comments1

Ericsson TingLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 29 May 2019Rich? no but you can be an okay rich by making a boglehead portfolio.sounds confusing?it is actually very simple What is a Boglehead investment philosophy?Boglehead investment philosophy simply follows a small number of simple investment principles that have been shown over time to produce risk-adjusted returns far greater than those achieved by the average investor.The basis of all of these principles is the idea that successful investing is not a complicated process, and can be accomplished by anyone with a small amount of effort.These ideas come from the investing philosophy of Vanguard-founder Jack Bogle, hence it is called the Boglehead investment philosophy9. Invest with simplicityThe boglehead investment philosophy is simply following a 3 fund portfolio, a local stock market index fund ETF(Which in my case is the STI ETF: ES3 or G3B), a local stock market bond index fund ETF(Singapore bond index fund: A35) and an international bond index fund(Vanguard ETF)Yup,with a boglehead strategy,you can get a decent return,for more information do refer to my blogpost: https://sonicericsg.blogspot.com/2019/01/post-74week-52learning-investingtrading.html0 comments0
